<<<api>>>: StringTokenizer.nextToken
<<<code>>>: public class TestStringTokenStrict {

/**
 * Strict implementation of StringTokenizer
 * 
 * @param str
 * @param delim
 * @param strict
 *            true = include NULL Token
 * @return
 */
static StringTokenizer getStringTokenizerStrict(String str, String delim, boolean strict) {
```scss
    StringTokenizer st = new StringTokenizer(str, delim, strict);
    StringBuffer sb = new StringBuffer();

    while (st.hasMoreTokens()) {
        String s = st.nextToken();
        if (s.equals(delim)) {
            sb.append(" ").append(delim);
        } else {
            sb.append(s).append(delim);
            if (st.hasMoreTokens())
                st.nextToken();
        }
    }
    return (new StringTokenizer(sb.toString(), delim));
}

static void altStringTokenizer(StringTokenizer st) {
    while (st.hasMoreTokens()) {
        String type = st.nextToken();
        String one = st.nextToken();
        String two = st.nextToken();
        String three = st.nextToken();
        String four = st.nextToken();
        String five = st.nextToken();

        System.out.println(
                "[" + type + "] [" + one + "] [" + two + "] [" + three + "] [" + four + "] [" + five + "]");
    }
}

public static void main(String[] args) {
    String input = "Record|One||Three||Five";
    altStringTokenizer(getStringTokenizerStrict(input, "|", true));
}
```
}

<<<explanation>>>: To extract multiple substrings from a string using the `substring` method in Java, you need to specify the start and end indices of each substring. The `indexOf` method can be used to find the position of the delimiter within the string. Here's an example of how to extract the second word:
```java
String input = "Record|One||Three||Five";
String delimiter = "|";
int startIndex = 0;
int endIndex = input.indexOf(delimiter) + delimiter.length();
String secondWord = input.substring(startIndex, endIndex);
System.out.println(secondWord);
```
This code finds the position of the delimiter within the string and adds its length to the start index to get the end index of the first substring. It then uses the `substring` method to extract the second word and assigns it to the `secondWord` variable. You can repeat this process to extract the remaining words from the string.
